archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Early twentieth-century photograph of a view from Massanutten Mountain, Virginia by Hugh Morrison, Jr., together with descriptive caption.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Massanutten Mountain Photograph must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Massanutten Mountain Photograph, Ms2008-066 - Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Massanutten Mountain Photograph was purchased by Special Collections in 2008.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing and description of the Massanutten Mountain Photograph commenced and was completed in August 2008.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Massanutten Mountain is a ridge between Virginia's Blue Ridge and Allegheny Mountains, bisecting the Shenandoah Valley and extending from Rockingham County in the south to Shenandoah County in the north. It has been known variously as Buffalo Mountain, Fort Mountain, Peaked Mountain, and Three Topped Mountain. At its highest point, Massanutten Mountain is 2,922 feet above sea level.

Hugh Morrison Jr. was born in 1871. He was a professional photographer in Woodstock (Shenandoah County), Virginia and served as the town's mayor from 1926 to 1938. Morrison died in Woodstock on September 18, 1950.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Massanutten Mountain Photograph was taken in the early twentieth century by Hugh Morrison Jr., of Woodstock, Virginia. Sepia-toned, the photo measures approximately 13" x 17" and is mounted on a larger backing. Below the photo is a caption, which reads in part, "View from Massanutten Mountain, looking west, and showing Woodstock, several of the horseshoe bends in Shenandoah river, and North Mountain in the distance."
